<div id="summary_of_configuration_parameters" class="registered_link"></div>

This summary table list all EDB Postgres Advanced Server configuration parameters along with a number of key attributes of the parameters.

These attributes are described by the following columns of the summary table:

-   Parameter. Configuration parameter name.

-   Scope of effect. Scope of effect of the configuration parameter setting:

    -   `C`. Cluster. Setting affects the entire database cluster, that is, all databases managed by the database server instance.
    -   `D`. Database. Setting can vary by database and is established when the database is created. Applies to a small number of parameters related to locale settings.
    -   `S`. Session. Setting can vary down to the granularity of individual sessions.

    In other words, different settings can be made for the following entities in which the latter settings in this list override prior ones: 
    
        -  The entire database cluster 
        -  Specific databases in the database cluster
        -  Specific roles
        -  Specific roles when connected to specific databases
        -  A specific session

-   When takes effect. When a changed parameter setting takes effect.

    -   `Preset`. Established when the EDB Postgres Advanced Server product is built or a particular database is created. This is a read-only parameter and can't be changed.
    -   `Restart`. You must restart the database server.
    -   `Reload`. You must reload configuration file or restart the database server.
    -   `Immediate`. Immediately effective in a session if the `PGOPTIONS` environment variable or the `SET` command is used to change the setting in the current session. Effective in new sessions if `ALTER DATABASE`, `ALTER ROLE`, or `ALTER ROLE IN DATABASE` commands are used to change the setting.

-   Authorized user. Type of operating system account or database role that must be used to put the parameter setting into effect.

    -   `Service`. The EDB Postgres Advanced Server service account (`enterprisedb` for an installation compatible with Oracle databases, `postgres` for a PostgreSQL compatible mode installation).
    -   `Super`. Database role with superuser privileges.
    -   `User`. Any database role with permissions on the affected database object, that is, the database or role to alter with the `ALTER` command.
    -   `n/a.`No user can change the parameter setting.

-   Description. Brief description of the configuration parameter.

Parameter names marked with [^1] are EPAS only parameters.

!!! Note
    A number of parameters can never be altered. These are designated as **Note: For internal use only** in the Description column.


| Parameter | Scope | When | User | Description |
| --------- |  ----- | ---- | ---- | ----------- |
| `allow_system_table_mods`                  | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Allows modifications of the structure of system tables.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `application_name`                         | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the application name to be reported in statistics and logs.                                                                                                                                                          |
| `archive_command`                          | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the shell command called to archive a WAL file.                                                                                                                                                         |
| `archive_mode`                             | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Allows archiving of WAL files using `archive_command`.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `archive_timeout`                          | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Forces a switch to the next xlog file if a new file has not been started within N seconds.                                                                                                                                |
| `array_nulls`                              | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables input of NULL elements in arrays.                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| `authentication_timeout`                   | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the maximum allowed time to complete client authentication.                                                                                                                                                          |
| `autovacuum`                               | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Starts the autovacuum subprocess.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| `autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor`          | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of `reltuples`.                                                                                                                               |
| `autovacuum_analyze_threshold`             | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze.                                                                                                                                                    |
| `autovacuum_freeze_max_age`                | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound.                                                                                                                                                  |
| `autovacuum_max_workers`                   | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes.                                                                                                                                            |
| `autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age`      | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound.                                                                                                                                             |
| `autovacuum_naptime`                       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Time to sleep between autovacuum runs.                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay`             | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum.                                                                                                                                                                        |
| `autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit`             | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum.                                                                                                                                                              |
| `autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor`           | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of `reltuples`.                                                                                                                                          |
| `autovacuum_vacuum_threshold`              | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum.                                                                                                                                                               |
| `autovacuum_work_mem`                      | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.                                                                                                                                                     |
| `backslash_quote`                          | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets whether `"\'"` is allowed in string literals.                                                                                                                                                                        |
| `bgwriter_delay`                           | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Background writer sleep time between rounds.                                                                                                                                                                              |
| `bgwriter_lru_maxpages`                    | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Background writer maximum number of LRU pages to flush per round.                                                                                                                                                         |
| `bgwriter_lru_multiplier`                  | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Multiple of the average buffer usage to free per round.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `block_size`                               | C         | Preset                                 | n/a                        | Shows the size of a disk block.                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `bonjour`                                  | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Enables advertising the server via Bonjour.                                                                                                                                                                               |
| `bonjour_name`                             | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the Bonjour service name.                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| `bytea_output`                             | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the output format for `bytea`.                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| `check_function_bodies`                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Checks function bodies during `CREATE FUNCTION`.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `checkpoint_completion_target`             | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Time spent flushing dirty buffers during checkpoint, as fraction of checkpoint interval.                                                                                                                                  |
| `checkpoint_segments` (Deprecated)                     | -      | -                             | -                 | (Deprecated) Specifies a value for the parameter prevents the server from starting.                                                                                                                                               |
| `checkpoint_timeout`                       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| `checkpoint_warning`                       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Enables warnings if checkpoint segments are filled more frequently than this.                                                                                                                                             |
| `client_encoding`                          | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the client's character set encoding.                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| `client_min_messages`                      | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the message levels that are sent to the client.                                                                                                                                                                      |
| `commit_delay`                             | S         | Immediate                              | Super                  | Sets the delay in microseconds between transaction commit and flushing WAL to disk.                                                                                                                                       |
| `commit_siblings`                          | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the minimum concurrent open transactions before performing `commit_delay`.                                                                                                                                           |
| `config_file`                              | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the server's main configuration file.                                                                                                                                                                                |
| `constraint_exclusion`                     | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner to use constraints to optimize queries.                                                                                                                                                               |
| `cpu_index_tuple_cost`                     | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each index entry during an index scan.                                                                                                                              |
| `cpu_operator_cost`                        | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each operator or function call.                                                                                                                                     |
| `cpu_tuple_cost`                           | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each tuple (row).                                                                                                                                                   |
| `cursor_tuple_fraction`                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the planner's estimate of the fraction of a cursor's rows to retrieve.                                                                                                                                    |
| `custom_variable_classes`[^1]              | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Deprecated in EDB Postgres Advanced Server 9.2.                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| `data_checksums`                           | C         | Preset                                 | n/a                        | Shows whether data checksums are turned on for this cluster.                                                                                                                                                              |
| `data_directory`                           | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the server's data directory.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| `datestyle`                                | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the display format for date and time values.                                                                                                                                                                         |
| `db_dialect`[^1]                               | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the precedence of built-in namespaces.                                                                                                                                                                               |
| `dbms_alert.max_alerts`[^1]                    | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets maximum number of alerts.                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| `dbms_pipe.total_message_buffer`[^1]          | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Specifies the total size of the buffer used for the `DBMS_PIPE` package.                                                                                                                                                  |
| `db_user_namespace`                        | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Enables per-database user names.                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| `deadlock_timeout`                         | S         | Immediate                              | Super                  | Sets the time to wait on a lock before checking for deadlock.                                                                                                                                                             |
| `debug_assertions`                         | C         | Preset                                 | n/a                        | Turns on various assertion checks. (Not supported in EPAS builds.)                                                                                                                                                        |
| `debug_pretty_print`                       | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Indents parse and plan tree displays.                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| `debug_print_parse`                        | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Logs each query's parse tree.                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| `debug_print_plan`                         | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Logs each query's execution plan.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| `debug_print_rewritten`                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Logs each query's rewritten parse tree.                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `default_heap_fillfactor`[^1]                 | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Creates new tables with this heap fill factor by default.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `default_statistics_target`                | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the default statistics target.                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| `default_tablespace`                       | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the default tablespace to create tables and indexes in.                                                                                                                                                              |
| `default_text_search_config`               | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets default text search configuration.                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `default_transaction_deferrable`           | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the default deferrable status of new transactions.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `default_transaction_isolation`            | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the transaction isolation level of each new transaction.                                                                                                                                                             |
| `default_transaction_read_only`            | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the default read-only status of new transactions.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `default_with_oids`                        | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Creates new tables with OIDs by default.                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `default_with_rowids`[^1]                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Creates new tables with ROWID support (ROWIDs with indexes) by default.                                                                                                                                                    |
| `dynamic_library_path`                     | S         | Immediate                              | Super                  | Sets the path for dynamically loadable modules.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `dynamic_shared_memory_type`               | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Selects the dynamic shared memory implementation used.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `edb_audit`[^1]                                | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Enables EDB Auditing to create audit reports in XML or CSV format.                                                                                                                                                         |
| `edb_audit_archiver`[^1]                       | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Enables audit log archiver process.                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| `edb_audit_archiver_timeout`[^1]               | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Checks the audit log files based on the `edb_audit_archiver_timeout` parameter.                                                                                                                                           |
| `edb_audit_archiver_filename_prefix`[^1]       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Determines audit log files with `edb_audit_archiver_filename_prefix` in `edb_audit_directory` are eligible for compression and/or expiration; the parameter must align with `edb_audit_filename`.                         |
| `edb_audit_archiver_compress_time_limit`[^1]   | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Shows time in seconds after which the audit logs are eligible for compression.                                                                                                                                            |
| `edb_audit_archiver_compress_size_limit`[^1]   | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Shows total size in megabytes after which the audit logs are eligible for compression.                                                                                                                                    |
| `edb_audit_archiver_compress_command`[^1]      | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Compresses the audit log files.                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `edb_audit_archiver_compress_suffix`[^1]       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Determines suffix for an already compressed log file. The parameter must align with `edb_audit_archiver_compress_command`.                                                                                                |
| `edb_audit_archiver_expire_time_limit`[^1]     | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Shows time in seconds after which the audit logs are eligible for expiration.                                                                                                                                             |
| `edb_audit_archiver_expire_size_limit`[^1]     | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Shows total size in megabytes after which the audit logs are eligible for expiration.                                                                                                                                     |
| `edb_audit_archiver_expire_command`[^1]        | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Execute on an expired audit log before removing it.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `edb_audit_archiver_sort_file`[^1]             | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Identifies the oldest log file and sorts them alphabetically or based on `mtime`.                                                                                                                                          |
| `edb_audit_connect`[^1]                        | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Audits each successful connection.                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| `edb_audit_destination`[^1]                    | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets `edb_audit_directory` or syslog as the destination directory for audit files. The syslog setting is only valid for a Linux system.                                                                                   |
| `edb_audit_directory`[^1]                      | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the destination directory for audit files.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `edb_audit_disconnect`[^1]                     | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Audits end of a session.                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| `edb_audit_filename`[^1]                       | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the file name pattern for audit files.                                                                                                                                                                               |
| `edb_audit_rotation_day`[^1]                   | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Automatic rotation of log files based on day of week.                                                                                                                                                                     |
| `edb_audit_rotation_seconds`[^1]               | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Automatic log file rotation occurs after N seconds.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `edb_audit_rotation_size`[^1]                  | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Automatic log file rotation occurs after N Megabytes.                                                                                                                                                                 |
| `edb_audit_statement`[^1]                      | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Sets the type of statements to audit.                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| `edb_audit_tag`[^1]                            | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Specifies a tag to include in the audit log.                                                                                                                                                                            |
| `edb_connectby_order`[^1]                      | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sorts results of `CONNECT BY` queries with no `ORDER BY` to depth-first order. Note: For internal use only.                                                                                                                |
| `edb_custom_plan_tries`[^1]                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Specifies the number of custom execution plans considered by the planner before the planner selects a generic execution plan.                                                                                             |
| `edb_data_redaction`[^1]                       | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables data redaction.                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `edb_dynatune`[^1]                             | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the edb utilization percentage.                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| `edb_dynatune_profile`[^1]                     | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the workload profile for dynatune.                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| `edb_enable_pruning`[^1]                       | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner to early-prune partitioned tables.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `edb_log_every_bulk_value`[^1]                 | S         | Immediate                              | Super                  | Sets the statements logged for bulk processing.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `edb_max_resource_groups`[^1]                  | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Specifies the maximum number of resource groups for simultaneous use.                                                                                                                                                     |
| `edb_max_spins_per_delay`[^1]                  | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Specifies the number of times a session spins while waiting for a lock.                                                                                                                                               |
| `edb_redwood_date`[^1]                         | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Determines whether `DATE` should behave like a `TIMESTAMP` or not.                                                                                                                                                        |
| `edb_redwood_greatest_least`[^1]               | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Determines how `GREATEST` and `LEAST` functions should handle NULL parameters.                                                                                                                                            |
| `edb_redwood_raw_names`[^1]                    | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Returns the unmodified name stored in the PostgreSQL system catalogs from Redwood interfaces.                                                                                                                              |
| `edb_redwood_strings`[^1]                      | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Treats `NULL` as an empty string when concatenated with a text value.                                                                                                                                                      |
| `edb_resource_group`[^1]                       | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Specifies the resource group to be used by the current process.                                                                                                                                                           |
| `edb_sql_protect.enabled`[^1]                  | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Defines whether SQL/Protect should track queries or not.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| `edb_sql_protect.level`[^1]                    | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Defines the behavior of SQL/Protect when an event is found.                                                                                                                                                               |
| `edb_sql_protect.max_protected_relations`[^1]  | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the maximum number of relations protected by SQL/Protect per role.                                                                                                                                                   |
| `edb_sql_protect.max_protected_roles`[^1]      | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the maximum number of roles protected by SQL/Protect.                                                                                                                                                                |
| `edb_sql_protect.max_queries_to_save`[^1]      | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Sets the maximum number of offending queries to save by SQL/Protect.                                                                                                                                                      |
| `edb_stmt_level_tx`[^1]                        | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Allows continuing on errors instead of requiring a transaction abort.                                                                                                                                                     |
| `edb_wait_states.directory`[^1]                | C         | Restart                                | Service       | Stores the EDB wait states logs in this directory.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `edb_wait_states.retention_period`[^1]         | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | Deletes EDB wait state log files after retention period.                                                                                                                                            |
| `edb_wait_states.sampling_interval`[^1]        | C         | Reload                                 | Service       | The interval between two EDB wait state sampling cycles.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| `edbldr.empty_csv_field`[^1]                   | S         | Immediate                              | Super                  | Specifies how EDB\*Loader handles empty strings.                                                                                                                                                                          |
| `effective_cache_size`                     | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Sets the planner's assumption about the size of the disk cache.                                                                                                                                                           |
| `effective_io_concurrency`                 | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem.                                                                                                                                    |
| `enable_bitmapscan`                        | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner's use of bitmap-scan plans.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| `enable_hashagg`                           | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner's use of hashed aggregation plans.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `enable_hashjoin`                          | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner's use of hash join plans.                                                                                                                                                                             |

| `enable_indexonlyscan`                     | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the plannerâ€™s use of index-only-scan plans.                                                                                                                                                                       |
| `enable_indexscan`                         | S         | Immediate                              | User                       | Enables the planner's use of index-scan plans.                                                                                                                                                                            |
